definitions.definition: happening or coming next after the first in a series of similar things or people; 2nd

examples.text: This is the second time it's happened.
Italy scored a second goal just after half-time.
He was the second to arrive.
We have one child and are expecting our second in July.

definitions.definition: next in order of importance, size, quality, etc. to one other person or thing

examples.text: Basketball is **second only to** soccer in global popularity.
As a dancer, he is **second to none** *(= nobody is a better dancer than he is)*.

definitions.definition: another; in addition to one that you already own or use

examples.text: They have a second home in Tuscany.
teachers of English as a second language *(= to people who already speak one or more other languages)*

wordOrigin: determiner Middle English: via Old French from Latin secundus ‘following, second’, from the base of sequi ‘follow’. The verb dates from the late 16th cent.
